result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:18 AM Defendant Brandon C Gibson appeared by video, in custody from Oshkosh Correctional.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Brandon C Gibson.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz asks for a Prelim be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing in person
bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon C Gibson
Current: Dodge Correctional Inst. DOC #685610, PO Box 700, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2022)
Prior: 1456 N 18 St, Milwaukee, WI 53205
Status hearing on August 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:10 PM Defendant Brandon C Gibson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Brandon C Gibson.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz did meet with his client today; requests more time to review the offer.  Atty Gumz states that there is a revocation hearing set for June 2nd; requests either a status or Pelim be set.

Atty Gumz asks for the bond to be amended to a $100 cash bond.  Atty Burdon objects to the bond modification and makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:   Motion to modify the cash bond is denied; cash bond will remain the same
Set status
Status hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

08:35 AM Defendant Brandon C Gibson appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail with Attorney Mark J Gumz. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  
Atty Gumz states that the defendant waives the time limits.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:    Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
  Court confirms address.  Status hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:15 AM Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon C Gibson appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.
Court questions the defendant regarding an attorney.  Defendant didn't know the attorney had to be the one from Marquette County.  Defendant wants to have an attorney.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset the IA  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

10:33 AM Defendant Brandon C Gibson appeared by video means (in custody). Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Defendant wishes to contact an attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.
Atty Juech requests $500 cash bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 cash bond with conditions.  Set for IA.
  Initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
